subject: RE: [junit] how to run junit test with an object dependency which returns multiple values
msgSnippet: I do not think this is a test related question, rather a more general programming question regarding interfaces and implementations of interfaces. In the given
messageBody:
I do not think this is a test related question, rather a more general
programming question regarding interfaces and implementations of
interfaces.



In the given code I cannot see anything implementing the interface.



Andreas



________________________________

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
J. B. Rainsberger
Sent: Monday, June 12, 2006 1:15 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] how to run junit test with an object dependency
which returns multiple values



joeytran2002 wrote:
>
>
> Hi Guru,
> Suppose I have these classes
> interface A{
> double getSalary(Employee a);
> }
>
> class B{
> private A a;
> public void setA(A _a){
> this.a = _a;
> }
> public getTotalSalary(List<Employee> lstEmployee){
> double totalSalary = 0;
> for(int i =0; i< lstEmployee.size(); i++)
> totlaSalary =+ a.getSalary(lstEmployee.get(i);
>
> return salary;
> }
> }
>
> How do I set up interface A in class B, so that a will return
> different value for each Employee in the Employee list

I don't understand the question. Could you give us an example of what
you're trying to do?
